Package shapes

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Circle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shape
    class Circle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shape
    This is the circle class, it will be one of the three shapes used to demonstrate polymorphism.

    It will directly implement the shape interface and will define the methods associated with it.

    A circle is created using 1 parameter, Radius.

    Author:
    Dalton

    • Constructor Detail

      • Circle

        public Circle​(int r)
        The primary constructor for the circle class. The parameter, r, will become the radius of the declared circle.

        This constructor also initializes area and perimeter using the radius.

        Parameters:
        r - Is the parameter for the circle's radius. It will be used to instantiate the circle's radius.

    • Method Detail

      • getRadius

        public int getRadius()
        Retrieves the radius for this circle.

        NOTE: Method not used because it doesn't demonstrate polymorphism

        Returns:
        Integer representation of the circle's radius

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius​(int r)
        Sets radius of circle to the value specified in the parameter.

        This method also recalculates area and perimeter.

        NOTE: Method not used because it doesn't demonstrate polymorphism

        Parameters:
        r - The value that will become the circle's radius

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter()
        This overridden function retrieves the perimeter of this shape.

        This function was specified by the Shape interface.

        Specified by:
        getPerimeter in interface Shape
        Returns:
        The double representation of the perimeter.

        public double getArea()
        This overridden function retrieves the area of this shape.

        The double representation of the area.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        This overridden function retrieves type of shape this object is, i.e. "Circle" for circle.

        This function was specified by the Shape interface.

        Specified by:
        getType in interface Shape
        Returns:
        A string representation of the type of shape the object is

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overridden toString() function. It allows circle objects to be printed directly to the console.

        This function was specified in the Shape interface

        Specified by:
        toString in interface Shape
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of a shape

      • compareArea

        public void compareArea​(Shape rhs)
        Method compares the areas of two shape objects, printing the greater area.

        This method will be equivalent in all shape types

        Specified by:
        compareArea in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        rhs - Shape object being compared to.

      • comparePerimeter

        public void comparePerimeter​(Shape rhs)
        Method compares the perimeters of two shape objects, printing the greater perimeter.

        This method will be equivalent in all shape types

        Specified by:
        comparePerimeter in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        rhs - Shape object being compared to.
